likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the Delayed Transition scenario, with a temperature increase of 2.5°C, the likelihood of extreme weather events affecting supply chains and production increases due to higher climate variability. This also raises the potential impact on operations and logistics, leading to a moderate increase in both likelihood and impact.

emerging_opportunities.opportunity: Increased Demand for Remote Work Solutions
emerging_opportunities.description: As extreme weather events increase, there may be a greater emphasis on remote work capabilities, driving demand for Mac products that support telecommuting.

additional_challenges.description: Extreme weather can disrupt logistics and supply chains, leading to delays in production and distribution of Mac products.

mitigation_strategies.description: Establishing multiple suppliers across different geographic regions to reduce dependency on a single source and mitigate risks from local extreme weather events.
Upgrading manufacturing facilities and logistics operations to withstand extreme weather events, including flood defenses and improved climate control systems.
